Title: Alcoholism as a Disease
Subtitle: (The Doctors Opinion from the Big Book)

Title: Eleventh Step Prayer
Subtitle: Prayer of Saint Francis of Assisi - "Lord, make me an instrument of your peace: where there is hatred, let me sow love; where there is injury, pardon; where there is doubt, faith; where there is despair, hope; where there is darkness, light; where there is sadness, joy. O divine Master, grant that I may not so much seek to be consoled as to console, to be understood as to understand, to be loved as to love. For it is in giving that we receive, it is in pardoning that we are pardoned, and it is in dying that we are born to eternal life."

Title: Emotional Sobriety
Subtitle: Recognizing emotions, accepting them, and learning to manage them effectively

Title: How do you work the steps?
Literature as a Tool
Subtitle: (Using the Big Book, Twelve and Twelve, Meditations, Etc)

Title: Practicing These Principles in All Our Affairs
The AA Preamble
Subtitle: Alcoholics Anonymous is a fellowship of people who share their experience, strength and hope with each other that they may solve their common problem and help others to recover from alcoholism.

Title: Step One
Subtitle: We admitted we were powerless over alcohol — that our lives had become unmanageable.

Title: Step Two
Subtitle: Came to believe that a Power greater than ourselves could restore us to sanity.

Title: Step Three
Subtitle: Made a decision to turn our will and our lives over to the care of God as we understood Him.

Title: Step Four
Subtitle: Made a searching and fearless moral inventory of ourselves.

Title: Step Five
Subtitle: Admitted to God, to ourselves, and to another human being the exact nature of our wrongs.

Title: Step Six
Subtitle: Were entirely ready to have God remove all these defects of character.

Title: Step Seven
Subtitle: Humbly asked Him to remove our shortcomings.

Title: Step Eight
Subtitle: Made a list of all persons we had harmed, and became willing to make amends to them all.

Title: Step Nine
Subtitle: Made direct amends to such people wherever possible, except when to do so would injure them or others.

Title: Step Ten
Subtitle: Continued to take personal inventory and when we were wrong promptly admitted it.

Title: Step Eleven
Subtitle: Sought through prayer and meditation to improve our conscious contact with God as we understood Him, praying only for knowledge of His will for us and the power to carry that out.

Title: Step Twelve
Subtitle: Having had a spiritual awakening as the result of these Steps, we tried to carry this message to alcoholics, and to practice these principles in all our affairs.

Title: Twelfth Step Calls
Subtitle: (going to see someone who is asking for help and/or drinking)

Title: We are not a glum lot
Subtitle: (from page 132 of the Big Book)

Title: What do you love about AA?
Who supported you?
Subtitle: Who supported you to get or stay sober?

Title: Live It
Subtitle: You may be the only Big Book a new person sees.
